mods.abstract: Runaway in Jail. WAS committed into the Jail of the Parish of St. Landry, on the 21st day of July 1856, a negro woman, grief color, calling herself CLARISSE, and saying she belongs to F. Bruner, residing in Plaquemin Brulée, in the Parish of St. Landry. Clarisse is stout built, aged 27 years, 4 feet 11 inches high, speaks English only. The owner is requested to come forward, prove property, pay charges and take her away, otherwise she will be disposed of according to law, after the legal delay. CHS. THOMPSON, Jailor. Opelousas, July 26, 1856.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
